intro: Hedyotis vestita, commonly known as the white-veined or white-stemmed mosquito plant, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its stems are often covered with fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Hedyotis vestita is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
